article_node.title: Emotional start to Premier League season as Liverpool honors Diogo Jota at Anfield
article_node.summary: Liverpool opened the Premier League season at Anfield with a 1‑0 win over Bournemouth, a match that was dominated by tributes to the late Diogo Jota and his brother André Silva, who died in a car crash earlier that month.  Fans and players observed a minute’s silence, displayed banners and sang “You’ll Never Walk Alone,” while new signing Hugo Ekitike scored the only goal, holding up Jota’s former No. 20 number.  The club also celebrated Jota’s legacy in the Community Shield, where a 20‑minute, 20‑second goal by Jeremie Frimpong echoed the tribute.  Amid the mourning, Liverpool’s new squad—highlighted by the record signing of Florian Wirtz—continues to build on a title‑winning season under manager Arne Slot, aiming for a repeat crown while honoring the memory of a beloved teammate.
